 10 module Sass
 11   # This is the class where all the parsing and processing of the Sass
 12   # template is done. It can be directly used by the user by creating a
 13   # new instance and calling <tt>render</tt> to render the template. For example:
 14   #
 15   #   template = File.load('stylesheets/sassy.sass')
 16   #   sass_engine = Sass::Engine.new(template)
 17   #   output = sass_engine.render
 18   #   puts output
 19   class Engine
 20     # The character that begins a CSS attribute.
 21     ATTRIBUTE_CHAR  = ?:
 22     
 23     # The character that designates that
 24     # an attribute should be assigned to the result of constant arithmetic.
 25     SCRIPT_CHAR     = ?=
 26 
 27     # The character that designates the beginning of a comment,
 28     # either Sass or CSS.
 29     COMMENT_CHAR = ?/
 30 
 31     # The character that follows the general COMMENT_CHAR and designates a Sass comment,
 32     # which is not output as a CSS comment.
 33     SASS_COMMENT_CHAR = ?/
 34 
 35     # The character that follows the general COMMENT_CHAR and designates a CSS comment,
 36     # which is embedded in the CSS document.
 37     CSS_COMMENT_CHAR = ?*
 38 
 39     # The character used to denote a compiler directive.
 40     DIRECTIVE_CHAR = ?@
 41     
 42     # The regex that matches attributes.
 43     ATTRIBUTE = /:([^\s=]+)\s*(=?)\s*(.*)/
 44   
 45     # Creates a new instace of Sass::Engine that will compile the given
 46     # template string when <tt>render</tt> is called.
 47     # See README for available options.
 48     #
 49     #--
 50     #
 51     # TODO: Add current options to REFRENCE. Remember :filename!
 52     #
 53     # When adding options, remember to add information about them
 54     # to README!
 55     #++
 56     #
 57     def initialize(template, options={})
 58       @options = {
 59         :style => :nested,
 60         :load_paths => ['.']
 61       }.merge! options
 62       @template = template.split("\n")
 63       @lines = []
 64       @constants = {}
 65     end
 66   
 67     # Processes the template and returns the result as a string.
 68     def render
 69       begin
 70         render_to_tree.to_s
 71       rescue SyntaxError => err
 72         unless err.sass_filename
 73           err.add_backtrace_entry(@options[:filename])
 74         end
 75         raise err
 76       end
 77     end
 78 
 79     alias_method :to_css, :render
 80 
 81     protected
 82 
 83     def constants
 84       @constants
 85     end
 86 
 87     def render_to_tree
 88       split_lines
 89       
 90       root = Tree::Node.new(@options[:style])
 91       index = 0
 92       while @lines[index]
 93         child, index = build_tree(index)
 94         
 95         if child.is_a? Tree::Node
 96           child.line = index 
 97           root << child
 98         elsif child.is_a? Array
 99           child.each do |c|
100             root << c
101           end
102         end
103       end
104       @line = nil
105 
106       root
107     end
108     
109     private
110     
111     # Readies each line in the template for parsing,
112     # and computes the tabulation of the line.
113     def split_lines
114       @line = 0
115       old_tabs = 0
116       @template.each_with_index do |line, index|
117         @line += 1
118 
119         tabs = count_tabs(line)
120           
121         if line[0] == COMMENT_CHAR && line[1] == SASS_COMMENT_CHAR && tabs == 0
122           tabs = old_tabs
123         end
124 
125         if tabs # if line isn't blank
126           if tabs - old_tabs > 1
127             raise SyntaxError.new("Illegal Indentation: Only two space characters are allowed as tabulation.", @line) 
128           end
129           @lines << [line.strip, tabs]
130           
131           old_tabs = tabs
132         else
133           @lines << ['//', old_tabs]
134         end
135       end
136 
137       @line = nil
138     end
139     
140     # Counts the tabulation of a line.
141     def count_tabs(line)
142       spaces = line.index(/[^ ]/)
143       if spaces
144         if spaces % 2 == 1 || line[spaces] == ?\t
145           raise SyntaxError.new("Illegal Indentation: Only two space characters are allowed as tabulation.", @line) 
146         end
147         spaces / 2
148       else
149         nil
150       end
151     end
152     
153     def build_tree(index)
154       line, tabs = @lines[index]
155       index += 1
156       @line = index
157       node = parse_line(line)
158 
159       has_children = has_children?(index, tabs)
160 
161       # Node is a symbol if it's non-outputting, like a constant assignment
162       unless node.is_a? Tree::Node
163         if has_children
164           if node == :constant
165             raise SyntaxError.new("Illegal nesting: Nothing may be nested beneath constants.", @line)
166           elsif node.is_a? Array
167             raise SyntaxError.new("Illegal nesting: Nothing may be nested beneath import directives.", @line)
168           end
169         end
170 
171         return node, index
172       end
173 
174       if node.is_a? Tree::CommentNode
175         while has_children
176           line, index = raw_next_line(index)
177           node << line
178 
179           has_children = has_children?(index, tabs)
180         end
181       else
182         while has_children
183           child, index = build_tree(index)
184           
185           if child == :constant
186             raise SyntaxError.new("Constants may only be declared at the root of a document.", @line)
187           elsif child.is_a? Array
188             raise SyntaxError.new("Import directives may only be used at the root of a document.", @line)
189           elsif child.is_a? Tree::Node
190             child.line = @line
191             node << child
192           end
193 
194           has_children = has_children?(index, tabs)
195         end
196       end
197       
198       return node, index
199     end
200     
201     def has_children?(index, tabs)
202       next_line = @lines[index]
203       next_line && next_line[1] > tabs
204     end
205 
206     def raw_next_line(index)
207       [@lines[index][0], index + 1]
208     end
209     
210     def parse_line(line)
211       case line[0]
212       when ATTRIBUTE_CHAR
213         parse_attribute(line)
214       when Constant::CONSTANT_CHAR
215         parse_constant(line)
216       when COMMENT_CHAR
217         parse_comment(line)
218       when DIRECTIVE_CHAR
219         parse_directive(line)
220       else
221         Tree::RuleNode.new(line, @options[:style])
222       end
223     end
224     
225     def parse_attribute(line)
226       name, eq, value = line.scan(ATTRIBUTE)[0]
227 
228       if name.nil? || value.nil?
229         raise SyntaxError.new("Invalid attribute: \"#{line}\"", @line)
230       end
231       
232       if eq[0] == SCRIPT_CHAR
233         value = Sass::Constant.parse(value, @constants, @line).to_s
234       end
235       
236       Tree::AttrNode.new(name, value, @options[:style])
237     end
238     
239     def parse_constant(line)
240       name, value = line.scan(Sass::Constant::MATCH)[0]
241       unless name && value
242         raise SyntaxError.new("Invalid constant: \"#{line}\"", @line)
243       end
244       @constants[name] = Sass::Constant.parse(value, @constants, @line)
245       :constant
246     end
247 
248     def parse_comment(line)
249       if line[1] == SASS_COMMENT_CHAR
250         :comment
251       elsif line[1] == CSS_COMMENT_CHAR
252         Tree::CommentNode.new(line, @options[:style])
253       else
254         Tree::RuleNode.new(line, @options[:style])
255       end
256     end
257 
258     def parse_directive(line)
259       directive, value = line[1..-1].split(/\s+/, 2)
260 
261       case directive
262       when "import"
263         import(value)
264       else
265         raise SyntaxError.new("Unknown compiler directive: #{"@#{directive} #{value}".dump}", @line)
266       end
267     end
268 
269     def import(files)
270       nodes = []
271 
272       files.split(/,\s*/).each do |filename|
273         engine = nil
274         filename = find_file_to_import(filename)
275         if filename =~ /\.css$/
276           nodes << Tree::ValueNode.new("@import #{filename}", @options[:style])
277         else
278           File.open(filename) do |file|
279             new_options = @options.dup
280             new_options[:filename] = filename
281             engine = Sass::Engine.new(file.read, @options)
282           end
283 
284           engine.constants.merge! @constants
285 
286           begin
287             root = engine.render_to_tree
288           rescue Sass::SyntaxError => err
289             err.add_backtrace_entry(filename)
290             raise err
291           end
292           root.children.each do |child|
293             child.filename = filename
294             nodes << child
295           end
296           @constants = engine.constants
297         end
298       end
299 
300       nodes
301     end
302 
303     def find_file_to_import(filename)
304       was_sass = false
305       original_filename = filename
306       new_filename = nil
307 
308       if filename[-5..-1] == ".sass"
309         filename = filename[0...-5]
310         was_sass = true
311       elsif filename[-4..-1] == ".css"
312         return filename
313       end
314 
315       @options[:load_paths].each do |path|
316         full_path = File.join(path, filename) + '.sass'
317         
318         if File.readable?(full_path)
319           new_filename = full_path
320           break
321         end
322       end
323 
324       if new_filename.nil?
325         if was_sass
326           raise SyntaxError.new("File to import not found or unreadable: #{original_filename}", @line)
327         else
328           return filename + '.css'
329         end
330       else
331         new_filename
332       end
333     end
334   end
335 end
